name: Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis (GPA) with Atypical Ocular Manifestations
chief_complaint: Persistent eye pain, blurred vision, and joint swelling for the past 3 months
physical_findings: Synovitis in small joints of hands
treatment: Rituximab or cyclophosphamide for remission induction
prognosis: Guarded - requires aggressive immunosuppression to prevent vision loss and renal involvement. 5-year survival >80% with proper treatment but risk of relapse remains high.
description: A rare variant of GPA presenting with predominant ocular involvement (scleritis, uveitis, or retinal vasculitis) before systemic manifestations become apparent. This form is particularly challenging as it may mimic infectious or other autoimmune ocular diseases. The condition represents a vasculitis of small-to-medium vessels with granulomatous inflammation.
risk_factors: Chronic nasal carriage of S. aureus
